article:
'Pseudorealism', also spelled 'pseudo-realism', is a term used in a variety of
discourses (often pejoratively) connoting any artistic and dramatic technique,
or work of art, film and literature perceived as superficial, not-real or non-
realistic. Eric Loren Smoodin, Ann Martin, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=R-Fs0Vwa_nQC&pg=PA235&dq=%22pseudo-
realism%22&hl=en&ei=xaHOTtSkB8OViQKC6LXPBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum-
=4&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=%22pseudo-realism%22&f=false Hollywood quarterly:
film culture in postwar America, 1945-1957. Page 235.] University of California
Press. The term is often used to describe artistic methods deviating from
what's commonly referred to as an accurate representation of reality. By
definition, the term is highly subjective. [http://www.huxley.net/ A Defence Of Paradise-Engineering.] BLTC
Research, 1998. Use of term: pseudo-realism. For example, Bangalore-born
artist Devajyoti Ray would like to see it as a separate art-form in conjunction
with his own figurative paintings created more freely in the context of Indian
art. Hasina Khatib, [http://www.hindustantimes.com/Lifestyle/ArtAndCulture/Pseudorealism-back-in-
Mumbai/Article1-768849.aspx "Pseudorealism back in Mumbai".] Hindustan Times.
Mumbai, November 14, 2011. Meanwhile, at the opposite end of the spectrum,
the term is used to describe photorealistic CGI animation and 3D computer
graphics indistinguishable from cine-photography. David Surman,
[http://www.gamecareerguide.com/features/227/masters_thesis_cgi_animation__.php
Master's Thesis: CGI Animation - Pseudorealism, Perception and Possible Worlds].
GameCareerGuide.com. Retrieved on 2010-10-21. Yet, other sources might
equate pseudorealism with Magic realism, popular in film, literature, and visual
arts, [http://www.pseudo-realism.com/whatisit.htm
What is pseudo-realism? Pseudo-realism.com.]Â  or even the cynical pseudo-
realism of the Stalinist era as exposed by Orwell. Christopher
Hitchens, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=9GnOe11NJXUC&pg=PA93&lpg=PA93&dq=def-
inition+of+pseudo-
realism&source=bl&ots=4f_qyMo9cg&sig=VUkTJ3B4EpDI3VQTv8Bu9cIqhsk&hl=en&ei=iprOT-
oTmOYPKiALAnP28Cw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDQQ6AEwBDgK#v=on-
epage&q=definition%20of%20pseudo-realism&f=false Why Orwell Matters. Page 93.]
Basic Books, 2003. ISBN 0-465-03050-5.

The term has also often been used to describe a certain type of film
productions, TV programmes, and video games, where special
effects, computer generated imagery and 3D animation are used to augment reality
based images. In this context the word pseudoreal has a negative connotation.

According to some, the term pseudorealism in reference to art, has a parallel in
mathematical field of representation theory or the idea that something unreal
can still give the impression of the real. [http://swinburne.academia.edu/DavidSurman David Surman |
Swinburne University of Technology - Academia.edu]. Swinburne.academia.edu.
Retrieved on 2010-10-21. There, a (pseudo real) Quaternionic
representation is a group representation that is equivalent to its complex
conjugate, but that is not a real representation.
